qas.question: What are the two main prevalent infectious diseases of Mali?
what arthropod born disease has plagued the nation?
According to the data from 2001 to 2006 what percent of female genitalia are mutilated?
What Sexually transmitted disease afflicts roughly 1.9 percent of the population?
Malians suffer from malnutrition and low rates of what type of medical need?
Where are there adequate medical facilities?
What type of diseases are now where in Mali?
In what year was less than 85% of girls and women mutilated?
What disease is rare among children?

context: Medical facilities in <b5_0>Mali<b5_0/> are very limited, and medicines are in short supply. <a1_0><b6_0>Malaria<a1_0/> and other arthropod-borne diseases<b6_0/> are prevalent in Mali, as are a number of infectious diseases such as <a0_0>cholera and tuberculosis<a0_0/>. Mali's population also suffers from a high rate of child malnutrition and a low rate of <a4_0>immunization<a4_0/>. An estimated 1.9 percent of the adult and children population was afflicted with <a3_0><b8_0>HIV/AIDS<b8_0/><a3_0/> that year, among the lowest rates in Sub-Saharan Africa. An estimated <a2_0>85–91<a2_0/> percent of Mali's girls and women have had female genital mutilation (<b7_0>2006 and 2001<b7_0/> data).
